content: Great App! Works great. Would be nice to be able to mute the sound from a monitor. We use two in our house and sometimes I can't hear the noise from the monitor I'm interested in because the monitor in the other room is making a lot of noise.
replyContent: Thanks for your great review Marisa, selective baby unit muting is planned for future updates. Happy 2021. Martin!

content: Using the app, without an account, for monitoring over wifi is no longer available. I have been using this app on ios for almost an year. Upon downloading here on Android, finding that app now requires an account. I'm not interested in cloud monitoring option.
replyContent: The account is required to enable end-to-end encryption of audio and video, and for easier device pairing. On iOS the unlimited range is optional, on the Android it is mandatory because Android support for nearby device discovery that is used to discover the devices on the same wifi - does not work reliably. Thanks for your understanding. Martin.

content: Helpful devs. Fixed the issue I've received. Perfect.
replyContent: Hi Ivan, please get in touch via support@cloudbabymonitor.com and send me your account email. I will investigate. The app works great between Android and iPad as long as both devices are signed into the same account and have a reasonably good internet connection. Please get in touch. Thanks, Martin!

content: Pretty good overall. A couple of features that would improve the app: 1. When using with multiple baby units: the ability to mute one of the units when observing from the parent unit (so that you could listen to one baby at a time, instead of both). 2. vox sensitivity feature: so that you could have the monitor open and observe video, but only hear sounds above a certain threshold (instead of hearing all sounds all the time)--the alert thresholds are nice, but there should be a basic threshold for passing audio when the unit is open as well. 3. A white noise filter would be nice, for those of us using white noise machines and shushers to help our babies sleep.
replyContent: Thanks for your great review Jordan, and for sensible suggestions. All noted down and we would love to bring them in the future updates. Please keep your suggestions coming via support@cloudbabymonitor.com. Thanks. Martin!

content: Very pleased. I am very impressed with how well this works. More flexible than the $400 Nanit product we were considering. With so many extra devices laying around this was a no-brainer. Love it.

content: This app is truly awesome! No idea why the ratings are not in the high 4's. We use an old iphone as the baby unit and an old android as the parent unit (handy hint, turn off battery optimisation for the app). Really love how simple it is. Works better and connects faster with each update. Suggestion for future: 1-A recording function (video and sound) so I can use it as a nanny cam and recording a snippet when he wakes up. 2-Movement/Sound activation options (e.g. gentle alert or high alert)
replyContent: Hi Johan, thanks for your great review and feature suggestions :) Will take them into account :) Martin. Feel free to get in touch via support@cloudbabymonitor.com with ideas how to make the app better for your needs. Thanks, Martin.

content: I have loved this app since the first time I bought it. I love how they have improved it over the years and have recommended to all my friends with children. I also appreciate the quick response with the developer whenever I have issues. Amazing app

content: Great baby monitor if you have a spare smart phone! Does more than most expensive monitors although can't do video at night as it uses the phone's camera. Two things I find annoying: 1. baby monitor randomly turns itself off sometimes (on iPhone), and 2. I can't connect to baby monitor when I use it on one of my old Samsung phones and use my current Samsung phone as the parent monitor. Other than that it's fantastic for such a cheap price!
replyContent: Hi Amy, thanks for your great review. Could you please get in touch with us via support@cloudbabymonitor.com. I'd love to learn more about the issues you are seeing? Do you use your iPhone parent unit with screen unlocked? Or locked? What model is the old Samsung? Please get in touch.

content: Another option to add if possible, is to be able to switch off the wifi on the baby's device, from the parent's device, so we do not have to enter into the room to stop it before going to bed for the night.

Do I understand it correctly that you want to switch off the app on the baby unit, not the wifi? Correct? Please get in touch, thanks, Martin.

content: Installed on my samsung and got the licence verification failed message in the app. Kept sending me back to play store after I had paid for the thing. Used to be so good on Apple products but the android version doesn't seem to work at all.
replyContent: Hi Mihaela, we are using google to verify that you purchased the app. If it fails it means google service is failing. Could you please restart your phone, make sure it is connected to the internet and try again? It must work. Please get in touch with us via support@cloudbabymonitor.com so that we can fix it somehow. Thanks, Martin

content: It works and has cool features but this is only useful in a well lit room. If the room is dim you can turn on nightlight which will Lind the poor child. Wish I couldve refunded this. Didn't suit my needs.
replyContent: Hi Travis, thanks for your review. The mobile devices can not capture video in darkness, that is why our app uses front camera of the baby unit device by default and uses device's screen to illuminate the crib. If you switch cameras manually, it will also use flash, but that is of course neither ideal nor recommended and not default.

content: First I want to state this app worked great with my IOS devices. The reason for this review is because the app and the developer said IOS and android devices could work together if they were signed into the same account. However that didn't happen. I cancelled the account within a few hrs when my devices didn't work together. But shortly after that the developer contacted me and told me that it could work and they would help us. I tried all the suggestions provided and none of them worked. So after a few days I tried to cancel the account. It turns out the original app refund never happened and so the app was purchased twice. I thought Google provided a warning to prevent you from buying the same item twice but I guess not. My bad - but I would expect to at least a refund for one of the apps. Especially since it didn't do what the app description and developer said it would do.
replyContent: Hi Julie, please get in touch with us via support@cloudbabymonitor.com, first I can make the Google Play Store refund happen if you wish but I would love to first learn what did not work and why. Let's get talking. Thanks, Martin.

content: Had trouble creating an account and logging in.

content: Disappointed. I bought this app purely because of the music/white noise option, thinking I could start the noise remotely (logical, otherwise I'd just use two free apps if I had to go into baby's room anyway). Turns out not only can I not set noise remotely - it plays loudly on my device and barely at all on hers - but the pause/stop function doesn't work - have to close app. Otherwise this is just like the free Dormi or Baby Monitor 3G. Save the $$. Wishing for a refund.
replyContent: Hi Janice, You can start/stop white noise remotely, and adjust its volume. When you stop the white noise, it will fade out slowly over a period of 2 minutes to not wake up the baby. We will make it clear in one of the future updates. Please get in touch with us via support@cloudbabymonitor.com. I would like to help fix the volume. Thanks, Martin.

content: For an app that is cloud based you would think that they were not charge you again for the app when you switch from iOS to android, but I guess like all others they are trying to make as much money as possible. content: Excellent app and support, works across IoS and Android seamlessly. To work across Android phones without having to purchase multiple copies, enable Google Play Family Library.

Just started using this app and got the first real night's sleep in a week! could not be more pleased!! The audio picks up every sound, which is EXACTLY what I wanted! I am monitoring my elderly parent, and they are much stealthier than an infant.
EDIT: Posted a negative review earlier about crashing but after posting that review and reaching out, app started working. pretty happy with this now. Thank you for whatever that was done.
replyContent: Thank your Zarna. Please get in touch with us via support@cloudbabymonitor.com if the app does not work as expected. We will be happy to help. Thanks Martin.

content: ignore the shity comment. people just can't read manual. i am more than happy with this app. am using 5s as monitor and streaming to iPhone xr and samsung s10+ amazing quality and motion detection. no problems at all. just had to pay twice since am using 2 different system ios and android but money well spend. to creators of this app big blessing from me :) and thank you for this app ... edit battery life is very good had 50% charger iphone and still streaming after 8 hours. very goood

content: The app works across my Apple devices, but isnt working on my Google Pixel 1. Instead of opening the monitor when I select Parent Device, the app tells me a baby monitor is not detected. aAe there any fixes ?

content: It does work... However. The battery usage is off the charts. - literally. The battery monitor in Android registers a spike/blip and suddenly I'm on reserve. This app will completely flatten my moto X4, from 100% to emergency shut down, in about 45 minutes. Movement detection and sound detection on the baby unit that pushes to the parent units to start the audio and video stream is a must. At the moment the stream is just on -always- This doesn't represent $7.50 AUD worth of app. Disappointed.
replyContent: Hi Josh, the audio and video stream is on when both devices have screen on. Turn screen off on either device to go audio only. We do not want to have the device decide whether your baby needs you, that is better left to the parent, that‚Äôs why the stream is always on. For example, a little one vomiting is super silent, you do not want to miss it.

content: Didn't even install. Error 910. Tried everything :/

(Error 910 happens due to SD card set as a default storage.). Please get in touch with us via support@cloudbabymonitor.com if the error does not go away. Thanks. Martin.
